intro: Meconopsis biloba, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple petals and is often found in alpine meadows at high altitudes. The plant belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is known for its delicate, cup-shaped flowers. Meconopsis biloba thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil.
